title: Citi Recognizes the Efforts of Venezuelan Microentrepreneurs
summary: Caracas - For the ninth year in a row, The Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards - promoted and organized by Citibank Venezuela and the Citi Foundation, with the support of Asociación Civil Centro Lyra - has raised awareness of the importance of microcredit as a way to reduce poverty and the contributions microentrepreneurs make to their local economies with their efforts and talent.
tag-1: Citi Recognizes the Efforts of Venezuelan Microentrepreneurs
tag-3: Caracas – For the ninth year in a row, The Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards – promoted and organized by Citibank Venezuela and the Citi Foundation, with the support of Asociación Civil Centro Lyra – has raised awareness of the importance of microcredit as a way to reduce poverty and the contributions microentrepreneurs make to their local economies with their efforts and talent.
tag-4: Winners were selected by a highly qualified judging committee made up of: Julio César Pérez, Head of Inspections, Sudeban; Manuel Malaret, Director of SME and Microenterprise Promotion, CAF; Gonzalo Fernández, Presidential Advisor, Digitel; Aleana González, Head of the Editorial Board, El Nacional newspaper; Félix Gallo, Director of the Clínica Metropolitana; Nunzia Auletta, Director of the IESA'S Entrepreneurial Center; Mary Gloria Olivo, General Director, FUDEP; and Nelson Acosta, President of Citibank Venezuela.
tag-5: This year, 10 winners in the categories of Production, Services, Commerce and a special mention for Social Action will receive cash awards according to their standing. The three first place winners will take home Bs. 26,650 each; the three second place winners will receive Bs. 18,230 each; and the three third place winners will be awarded Bs. 12,470 each. The winner of the special "Social Action" award will get Bs. 11,250. Most important, the winners will receive exposure and serve as models for their communities of the value of perseverance and overcoming adversity.
tag-6: The top microentrepreneurs will also have the opportunity to attend an entrepreneurial workshop led by IESA professors Aramis Rodríguez and Edwing Ojeda, both of whom are affiliated with the institute's Entrepreneurial Center. The workshop will focus on two areas: the CANVAS Business Model and Entrepreneurial Skills, including effective negotiation and presentation.
tag-7: The process of selecting the winners was based on the recommendations of Citi volunteers, who visited the nominees, studied their businesses, and presented the results before the judging committee.
tag-8: The Winners In the category of Production, first place went to Elías David Querales Guzmán and "Asociación Cooperativa Grupo ETNA Nuevo Amanecer R.L.," nominated by Cecosesola. The second place winner was Yuleidy Villamizar and her bakery and stationary shop "Panadería, Pastelería, Papelería Pan del Táchira," nominated by Banco del Pueblo. Third place was awarded to Alexander Bueno and "Enoba Sistemas C.A.," recommended by Banauge.
tag-9: In the Commerce category, the first place winner was Jesly Consentino with "Isla Orgánica C.A.," nominated by FUNDEFIR (Universidad de Sigo). In second place was Jaime Sánchez and "Pastelitos Ña Carmen C.A.," nominated by BBVA Provincial. Franklin José Rojas's "INVERSIONES FRANK 24," nominated by FUDEP, came in third.
tag-10: In Services, Alirio Niño Alvarez took home the top prize for "Lavadoras El Maracucho," presented by Banco del Pueblo. Second place went to Lizmary Carrizalez for "Tu Día Feliz De Fiesta C.A.," nominated by FUDEP, which also recommended the third place winner, Vladimir Ylitch Landaeta's "Vlady Burguer Express."
tag-11: This year, the judges also decided on a special "Social Action" award for microentrepreneurs concerned with the common good. The winner was Danilka Balcazar Colina, who runs a rehabilitation center that offers free screenings for low-income people with motor skills or speech problems. The Chacao Mayor's Office nominated her for the award.
